Aliases:
*Adonai. Traditional Jewish term for the deity, plural of Adon ("Master", "Lord"). 
Allah
Ego eimi. Ancient Greek language term for "I am" or "I exist". Used as a name for the deity in the Gospel of John. 
Ehyeh-Asher-Ehyeh. The name the deity uses for itself in the Book of Exodus. It is translated in English as "I Am that I Am" or "I Will Be What I Will Be". 
Elah
Eloah
Elohim
God
Ha'Shem or Hashem. Jewish term for "the Name" . Used as a name for the deity. 
Jah or Yah. Short form of YHWH in the Bible. Root word for certain Jewish theophoric names. 
Jehoveh. Anglicized version of Yehweh. 
Tetragrammaton. [1]. Tetragrammaton is a Greek-language term for "(consisting of) four letters". Representing the four letters which stand for the name of this deity. 
YHWH[1].  The four Latin letters used for the name of the deity, translating the Hebrew term. "Y" stands for the letter "Yodh", "H" stands for the letter "He", "W" stands for the letter "Waw".

Origin:
After years and years of mental anguish at having his power handed out to others such as Eric Masterson and Beta Ray Bill and being imprisoned in the form of Don Blake, Thor's mind slowly slipped into insanity. This was given form by the Valkyrie, a construct of Thor's own demented mind, created as a manifestation of its insanity. 
Valkyrie was originally a mental construct and later physical manifestation of Thor's insanity created by Thor's own demented mind. She was the manifestation of Thor's insanity, although he believed she was real. As time went on, she exerted more and more control over Thor until he obeyed her every suggestion and was like a slave to her.
Relatives: None, although she is truly just an aspect of Thor, so Thor's family may be considered hers in an abstract way.
Base Of Operations: Asgard, Inside the mind/at the side of Thor
Creators: Jim Starlin, Ron Marz, Bruce Zick
